div.p: This tag belongs conceptually within WRITING PRODUCTION . It records the final significant writing activity, published or otherwise, and should be used with all authors where evidence exists. It should contain a full sentence, and the only title tagged within it should be the title of the last work. If this tag is used in a CHRONSTRUCT it will display in the MILESTONES column of the Overview. It has no mandatory or optional sub-elements or attributes.

div.codeblock: <PLASTLITERARYACTIVITY>On her eighty-third birthday, Anne Grant wrote her last poem.</PLASTLITERARYACTIVITY>
<PLASTLITERARYACTIVITY>Joanna Baillie's last known work, Ahalya Baee, deals with an actual Indian female ruler.</PLASTLITERARYACTIVITY>

<PLASTLITERARYACTIVITY>Just before she died, Eleanor Anne Porden wrote a letter to her husband.</PLASTLITERARYACTIVITY> A volume of her letters was later collected and published as John Franklin's Bride in 1930. (n.b. Put PLASTLITERARYACTIVITY element around the first sentence only here, so that the whole collected volume does not appear to be her final work.)

div.p: As you can see from the examples, the last work is not always a published work. You might only wish to record that she wrote in her diary on the day she died.
